intro: Taraxacum subulicuspis, commonly known as the needle-cusped dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to parts of Asia, including China, Korea, and Japan, and thrives in temperate climates. The plant is characterized by its slender, spiky leaves and yellow composite flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
